lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Mikulic's proposed economic program, which also includes higher personal taxes as well as wage and price restraint, is intended to serve as a basis for the debt talks to demonstrate Yugoslavia's ability to eventually repay the credits.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Mikulic said foreign debt should be retained at about the same level as now until 1990 and the country should then be able to keep currency reserves equal to three months payments.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Yugoslav Prime Minister Branko Mikulic, unveiling a new draft economic program, said Yugoslavia would cut repayments on its almost 20 billion lr hard currency debt to bring them in line with its hard currency earning capacity.

lst.name: sentence

lst.name: sentence
